title: Liz Cheney
summary: Elizabeth Lynne Cheney[1] (/ˈtʃeɪni/ CHAYN-ee; born July 28, 1966[2]) is an American attorney and politician who has been the U.S. Representative for Wyoming's at-large congressional district since 2017. She was deputy assistant secretary of state for Near Eastern affairs in the George W. Bush administration and chaired the House Republican Conference, the third-highest position in the House Republican leadership, from 2019 to 2021.
